column5: data-page-title="Artnet News | The Global Art Market Newswire"

column4: ‘I Like the Wetness of the Process’: Artist Torbjørn Rødland on the Pleasure and Perversion of Analog Photography

column8: The soft-spoken photographer says the most important aspect of his work is the image itself.

column4: A New Documentary on HBO Shows How Black Artists Crafted Their Own Histories in the Face of an Art World That Excluded Them

column8: A new documentary on HBO takes as a point of departure a 1976 exhibition that changed everything.

column4: ‘We’re Always Looking for Different Perspectives’: Audemars Piguet’s In-House Curators on the Watchmaker’s Art Commissions

column8: Learn what it's like to run an art program at one of the world's top watchmaking houses.

column4: Art Industry News: Anna Delvey, Who Scammed New York’s Richest With Plans for a Private Museum, Is Out of Prison Early + Other Stories

column8: Plus, the Met picks an Instagram and critical favorite for this year's rooftop commission and Steve Martin helps launch a fund for Indigenous Australian art.

column4: Wet Paint: Artist Ryder Ripps and Azealia Banks Go Public as a Couple, Artist Accused of Stealing From His Mentor, & More Art-World Gossip

column8: What Chelsea gallery poached a director from an uptown rival? Which artist shot Bella Hadid for the new Givenchy line? Read on for answers.

column4: The Art Angle Podcast: 5 Steamy, Whirlwind Romances That Changed Art History

column8: From Salvador and Gala Dalí, to Jacob Lawrence and Gwendolyn Knight, here are the love stories that shaped art history.

column4: A 25-Year-Old PhD Student Just Convinced Lego to Mass-Produce Van Gogh’s ‘Starry Night’ as an Official Toy Kit

column8: Truman Cheng submitted the idea to the company, which invites fans to share their ideas for future Lego sets.

column4: A 1982 Basquiat Is Expected to Fetch Over $30 Million at Christie’s Hong Kong, Setting a Record for a Western Artist in Asia

column8: The sale shows confidence in the appetite for Western art in Asia.

column4: These 4 Sugar-Coated Artworks May Look Sweet, But They Also Tell Some Salty Truths About Society and Consumption

column8: Sweeten up your Valentine's Day with this candy-themed art.

column4: A Wholly Revamped Museum Will Open in Spain to House the Contemporary Art Collection of Dealer Helga de Alvear

column8: German art collector and dealer Helga de Alvear is gifting her entire collection to a Spanish region.

column4: ‘She Was Meant to Be So Fearful’: Watch Artist Firelei Báez Reimagine a Cruel Female Character From Dominican Folklore as a Feeling Person

column8: As part of a collaboration with Art21, hear news-making artists describe their inspirations in their own words.

column4: Christie’s Has Closed Off Public Access to Its 255-Year-Old Auction Archive, a Major Resource for Scholars, Citing Budget Concerns

column8: The library is considered to be the most comprehensive auction archive in the world.

column4: Damien Hirst Is Taking Over One of Gagosian’s London Galleries as Curator for an Entire Year

column8: The artist will organize shows of his own work and that of other artists.

column4: Art Industry News: Police Get a Stunning Tip on the Fate of a Picasso Stolen From an Athens Museum + Other Stories

column8: Plus, an 18,000-year-old conch finally gets played again, and see inside Buontalenti's famed Mannerist grotto.

column4: What I Buy and Why: Art Dealer Ben Brown on the Tiny Matisse in His Bathroom and the One Massive Installation He’s Never Displayed

column8: We caught up with the gallerist on what's inside his personal collection.

column4: As Museums Desperately Try to Diversify Their Collections, They Now Face Another Problem: How to Pay for It in a Financial Crisis

column8: Some initiatives implemented prior to the pandemic have proved surprisingly resilient, while others are under major stress.

column4: Why Estonian Artist Flo Kasearu Enlisted Residents of a Women's Shelter as Collaborators on Her New Show

column8: Estonia has staggeringly high rates of violence against women.
